greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: G.f. A(x) satisfies (1-x) = product_{n>=1} A(x^n).
link: Paul D. Hanna, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: G.f.: A(x) = exp( -Sum_{n>=1} A023900(n)*x^n/n ), where A023900 is the Dirichlet inverse of Euler totient function.
Euler transform of the negative of the Möbius function. - _Stuart Clary_, Apr 15 2006
G.f.: A(x) = product_{k>=1}(1 - x^k)^mu(k) where mu(k) is the Möbius function, A008683. - _Stuart Clary_, Apr 15 2006
mathematica: nmax = 106; CoefficientList[ Series[ Product[ (1 - x^k)^(MoebiusMu[k]), {k, 1, nmax} ], {x, 0, nmax} ], x ] (* _Stuart Clary_, Apr 15 2006 *)
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Mar 03 2006
